data.meta_description: I met Nayera Korraa in 2020. We were both starting new jobs at SAP and learning about the pandemic's implications. Nayera was part of the first global teamâ€¦
data.text:
I am incredibly grateful for my first week at the SAP Academy for Customer Success in San Ramon, California, after spending an intense 5 months in virtual engagements. Here are 3 main takeaways that Iâ€™d like to share: 1ï¸âƒ£ Teamwork ğŸ™Œ : Having participated in a myriad of team activities, I have been reminded of the power of collaboration and the importance of every individual's contribution. We have been able to bring together diverse ideas to establish creative solutions. 2ï¸âƒ£ In-person Training ğŸ§ : Being able to physically participate in the sessions reaffirmed the value of face-to-face training. The dynamic exchange of knowledge, the immediate Q&A and the real-time feedback have greatly enhanced my learning experience. 3ï¸âƒ£ Networking ğŸ‘¥: While online sessions establish connections, nothing beats the networking capacity and community building of in-person interactions. Meeting professionals from various market units and cultures and sharing experiences has broadened my understanding of this globalized business. I am excited for the journey ahead and can't wait to contribute my best to SAP and our esteemed customers. Shout-out to the amazing people I have met this week. Here is to continuous growth and incessant learning! #SAPAcademy #CustomerSuccess #In-personLearning #Networking #Teamwork #ContinuousLearning #SiliconValley

100--ğŸŒŸ Celebrating Century of SAP Mentorship ğŸŒŸ What a journey it has been! In just four months, we've hit a milestone - helping 100 aspiring SAP professionals navigate the complex world of SAP. ğŸš€ These dedicated mentees embarked on their SAP journeys, and I had the privilege of guiding them towards a deeper understanding of this remarkable field. ğ‘»ğ’‰ğ’† ğ’ƒğ’†ğ’”ğ’• ğ’‘ğ’‚ğ’“ğ’•? Most of them aced interviews and are now part of renowned MNCs, paving their paths to success. ğ‘©ğ’–ğ’• ğ’‰ğ’†ğ’“ğ’†'ğ’” ğ’•ğ’‰ğ’† ğ’Œğ’Šğ’„ğ’Œğ’†ğ’“ - this journey wasn't just about me sharing knowledge. It was also about learning and growing together. My mentees shared their unique experiences, challenges, and insights, enriching my understanding of SAP. Thank you to Ankit Agarwal for the platform, topmate.io, which has been instrumental in connecting SAP enthusiasts, fostering a sense of community, and offering a collective understanding of the evolving SAP landscape. Today, I'm elated to be part of the exclusive 1% SAP mentor club, a recognition I wear with pride. The glorious tick mark affirms my identity as a trusted SAP consultant and the love that Linkedin Community has showered with their response and engagement. Here's to the mentees who've become future SAP leaders and to the knowledge shared that fuels our collective growth. ğŸŒ If you're on the SAP journey or need guidance, don't hesitate to reach out. Don't forget to checkout the lovely Testimonies. Let's continue shaping the future of SAP together! ğŸ¤ #SAPMentorship #Mentorship #SAPJourney #Topmate #SAPCommunity

ğŸŒŸ Taking a moment to reflect on my time at the SAP Academy in San Ramon, CA, it's clear this experience has been a catalyst for both professional and personal growth ğŸŒ±. Over four action-packed weeks, I've deepened my understanding ğŸ“š, expanded my network ğŸ‘¥, and even found some lifelong friends ğŸ¤. A highlight was presenting a live demo to Mohamed Yusuf, the Global Head of Solution Advisory. His insights were a game-changer, reinforcing the true potential of what we do. Building on this, I enabled an outstanding team of associates in showcasing AI's transformative power to executives like Scott Russell, the Head of Customer Success. It's experiences like these that drive home the real-world impact of our work ğŸŒ. Gratitude is due to my academy managers Fernando SÃ¡nchez Lara, Ivan Aguilar Duclaud, and Ruben Dario Acero ğŸ™. Their mentorship was my compass in this journey. A special nod to Mary Lange and Doug Robertson, whose commitment to the program set the gold standard for what professional development should be âœ¨. Amid this intensive training, I also co-hosted a talk with Mary Lange and Karina Montilla Edmonds on the pivotal role of women in the workforce ğŸ‘©ğŸ’¼. A timely and enriching discussion that added another layer to an already multi-faceted experience. The true gem of this program? The people ğŸŒŸ. Not only have I built a robust network spanning the entirety of SAP, but the spirit of collaboration among associates was genuinely uplifting. These relationships have evolved beyond just professional networks; Iâ€™m honored to call many my friends. As this intensive chapter closes, I'm energized for whatâ€™s next â©. From aligning solutions to driving innovation, the sky's the limit! Here's to a future full of impactful solutions and meaningful connections ğŸš€. #SAPAcademy #ProfessionalGrowth #Innovation #Teamwork #SolutionAdvisor #LifeAtSAP Philippe Nemery, PhD (he/him) | HÃ©lÃ¨ne Dastugue | Frank Soudan | Bernard Kenny | Yasmine Abdallah | Godfrey Leung | David Uichanco | Jessica Zhang
